column1: #Text=Basketball : Lakers score 102 to defeat the Celtics in Game 1 of the 2010 NBA Finals

#Text=EST Report Los Angeles Lakers 102 , Boston Celtics 89 Staples Center , Los Angeles , California Attendance : 18,997 Referees : Joe Crawford , Joe DeRosa , and Derrick Stafford ABC Scoring by quarter : 26 – 21 , 24 – 20 , 34 – 23 , 18 – 25 Pts : Bryant ( 30 ) , Gasol ( 23 ) , Artest ( 15 ) Rebs : Gasol ( 14 ) , Bryant ( 7 ) , Bynum ( 6 ) Asts : Bryant ( 6 ) , Gasol and Fisher ( 3 ) Pts : Pierce ( 24 ) , Garnett ( 16 ) , Rondo ( 13 ) Rebs : Pierce ( 9 ) , Rondo ( 6 ) , Garnett and Wallace ( 4 ) Asts : Rondo ( 8 ) , Pierce and Wallace ( 4 ) Los Angeles leads , 1 – 0

#Text=In basketball , Kobe Bryant hit a three-pointer late in the fourth quarter to lift the Los Angeles Lakers to a 102 – 89 victory over the Boston Celtics in Game 1 of the 2010 NBA Finals Thursday night in Los Angeles , California .
#Text=Bryant scored 30 points in the game to lead all scorers .
#Text=Kobe Bryant scored 30 points in Game 1 of the 2010 NBA Finals .
#Text=Bryant was backed-up by a 23-point , 14-rebound effort from Pau Gosol and 15 points from Ron Artest .
#Text=For Boston , Paul Pierce had 24 points and Kevin Garnett had 16 points .
#Text=" They were the more physical team by far , " Celtics coach Doc Rivers said after the game , according to the Associated Press .
